attributes.action: Demand Brian Barwick resigns as Chief Executive of the Football Association
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The new Wembley was over budget and over time.
Sven Goran Eriksson was paid too much and kept on for two years too long.
The selection process for Sven Goran Eriksson's successor was bungled and resulted Steve McCLaren being appointed as England manager when he was clearly not up to the job.
A game of American football was allowed at Wembley three weeks before the most important game for the English national team since the previous world cup, resulting in the pitch being ruined and which may have contributed to the poor performance of the team. 
Brian Barwick's part in this catalogue of incompetence means that he must be removed from his privileged position as Chief Executive of the FA.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
